{"editableAreas":[{"identifier":"area01","sections":[{"identifier":"de14e1eb-1891-401b-b191-b0d0b486e785","type":"MedioClinic.Section.SingleColumn","properties":null,"zones":[{"identifier":"425238ed-f946-4628-8f21-cc66c3c3089f","widgets":[{"identifier":"9d69d1f4-46ff-4034-a31e-58cb5c060935","type":"MedioClinic.Widget.Text","variants":[{"identifier":"f4b6d10f-b2ac-4788-a73b-fbcbea7a8ac2","properties":{"text":"

New medical center in Florida

"}}]}]}]},{"identifier":"9166f76c-bbce-4dcd-b35e-73715a3a00b7","type":"MedioClinic.Section.SingleColumn","properties":null,"zones":[{"identifier":"edeff6af-53b7-4f18-a845-20ad65139817","widgets":[{"identifier":"cc2bf280-a51d-4f5a-afea-6f60eca48a73","type":"Kentico.Widget.RichText","variants":[{"identifier":"0ae1468b-0241-428a-92c0-9dda8a749ef0","properties":{"content":"

After twenty years of our successful presence in Los Angeles and more than eight decades in our home town, Boston, MA, we're excited to announce the opening of a new medical center in Florida.

Right at the anniversary day of our original company registration, on December 1st, 2021, we'll be pleased to welcome you at the opening ceremony held at the new business complex in Lake Anion, Orlando.

Find details about the ceremony, its schedule, as well as the medical center itself below.

"}}]}]}]},{"identifier":"ef8ab21c-4dce-4122-9ff2-17e7f1d4c814","type":"MedioClinic.Section.TwoColumn","properties":{"leftColumnWidth":4},"zones":[{"identifier":"1af582b8-d324-434e-8f6a-ec438748df1b","widgets":[{"identifier":"bc88efc6-ac3d-4164-804a-eecc2c1aff16","type":"MedioClinic.Widget.Text","variants":[{"identifier":"a17680d1-d70d-4be7-86ef-ef767832345a","properties":{"text":"

Orlando medical center services

The list of services offered includes, but is not limited to:

Pre-departure consultation services

  • Choosing a suitable travel plan, incl. alternative routes
  • Risk assessment
  • Preliminary tuitions on infection sources
  • Assessment of medical services in the target area
  • En route preventive medication plans
  • First aid trainings

Long-term preventive treatment (2 to 6 months before departure)

  • Comprehensive health scans
  • Individual preventive treatment plans
  • All travel related immunizations & vaccination

En route treatment

  • Dedicated en route physicians
  • 24/7 remote support
  • Self-assisted en route treatment (according to medication plans)

Field research

  • Preliminary on-demand research
  • Self-funded field research

Academic services

  • Laboratory research services
  • Joint venture academic research

General medical services

General ambulance and same-day treatment service in the following areas:

  • Epidemiology
  • Infectious diseases
  • Primary care - internal medicine

a","type":"MedioClinic.Widget.Text","variants":[{"identifier":"9768c82b-d6f2-44b8-9f30-83d1234a1f36","properties":{"text":"

Meet John Backbone, chief of research, Medio Clinic

\"Choosing Orlando to host our highly specialized vaccination and travel medicine center was a logical decision. By cooperating with local universities, we not only can provide state of the art consultation services to travelers but also take part in the scientific research of tropical diseases,\" commented John Backbone, vice-chairman and chief of research of Medio Clinic.

\"The past decade showed an increasing demand for medical services connected to traveling to the Caribbean area and Latin America countries. Our clients in both New England, California, and Florida have constantly been asking us for assistance in preparing their business and vacation trips to these areas of the continent. We've significantly invested into talent to form a new specialized team of physicians and biologists focused solely on the tropical medicine,\" added John.

\"Be it consultations and advice about species living in a particular geographical area, the required pre-departure vaccination, the en route preventive treatment or first aid training, we help our clients to prepare for their journeys and support them during their trips, if necessary. To hapless travelers, we offer a broad range of retrospective treatment procedures to allow for a quick and safe recovery.\"

We asked John to reveal reasons that led to opening the Orlando medical center. \"One of our biggest clients is an oil extraction company with a handful of subsidiaries in the Amazon region of Brazil. We've not only ensured their key staff staying healthy during their exploration trips, but we had also collected valuable medical and biological research information thanks to the partnership. We then became the key piece connecting the pure academic research at the universities with field information collected thanks to the support we had provided to our clients.\"

\"It is a pleasure for us to welcome representatives of our biggest clients at the opening ceremony. It will be a start of a new era of our cooperation with all our corporate clients, academic partners, and private patients alike,\" John closed.

Effective April 1st, John will become the chief physician and head of research of the Orlando medical center.

"}}]}]}]},{"identifier":"d384e48d-41c8-4db1-bb40-1ed63a006d24","type":"MedioClinic.Section.TwoColumn","properties":{"leftColumnWidth":4},"zones":[{"identifier":"6083a88b-1e01-4ff6-9443-75b779fc2b8c","widgets":[{"identifier":"8e7340f0-d566-4101-8278-25599e3a6a7b","type":"MedioClinic.Widget.Text","variants":[{"identifier":"73e75690-73d6-4164-a0e2-d14f92ae25a9","properties":{"text":"

Opening ceremony schedule

The ceremony takes place at the new Lake Anion business center located at 9370 Insular Ln, Orlando, Florida.

4:00 PM

  • Registration

4:15 PM

  • Opening keynote (John Backbone)

4:30 PM

  • Partners' notes
  • University dean's note
  • Clients' notes
  • City mayor's note

5:00 PM

  • Guided tours in the center
  • Ask-the-experts sessions in laboratories
